3 times ending on 3rd time on row 4 for size l repeat chart 4 times ending 4th repeat on row 4 finishing steam block and let dry if you use malabrigo make sure your child doesnʼt accidentally toss her shrug in with the wash or it may just fit her doll instead have your child try on the shrug have her put her arms forward a little and hold them slightly bent at the elbows locate about an inch and a half below the armpit and connect with safety pins or hair jaw clips where you think the join should be have your child reach forward and also drop her hands to her sides to make certain it is not too loose or too tight compare both sides so the join begins in an equal place for both sides slip_stitch from the cuffs up to the top you marked as above weave in ends if you find that even post-blocking the sleeves are a bit tighter than you would like run a row of single_crochet up each side to the join edge and then slip_stitch together back of neck and sleeve edging check to make sure you have the upper back facing you fans are narrow side down you should have close to 50 60 70 single crochet stitches with which to work although this will vary according to where you sewed the sleeves up count them you will need to know the exact number if you have more work edging in center 50 60 70 sts if you have fewer than the required sts increase by adding a single row of single_crochet with wrong side facing adding equal increases on each side 2 single_crochet into each st note edging is worked with the same size hook but lace weight yarn back of neck join yarn row 1 2 double_crochet into back
